trans-unit.source: The **ProcessSet** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to configure processes on a target node.
trans-unit.target: The **ProcessSet** resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to configure processes on a target node.

trans-unit.source: This resource is a [composite resource](authoringResourceComposite.md) that calls the [WindowsProcess resource](windowsProcessResource.md) for each group specified in the `GroupName` parameter.
trans-unit.target: This resource is a [composite resource](authoringResourceComposite.md) that calls the [WindowsProcess resource](windowsProcessResource.md) for each group specified in the `GroupName` parameter.

trans-unit.source: A string that contains arguments to pass to the process as-is.
trans-unit.target: A string that contains arguments to pass to the process as-is.

trans-unit.source: If you need to pass several arguments, put them all in this string.
trans-unit.target: If you need to pass several arguments, put them all in this string.

trans-unit.source: The paths to the process executables.
trans-unit.target: The paths to the process executables.

trans-unit.source: If these are the names of the executable files (not fully qualified paths), the DSC resource will search the environment **Path** variable (`$env:Path`) to find the files.
trans-unit.target: If these are the names of the executable files (not fully qualified paths), the DSC resource will search the environment **Path** variable (`$env:Path`) to find the files.

trans-unit.source: If the values of this property are fully qualified paths, DSC will not use the **Path** environment variable to find the files, and will throw an error if any of the paths do not exist.
trans-unit.target: If the values of this property are fully qualified paths, DSC will not use the **Path** environment variable to find the files, and will throw an error if any of the paths do not exist.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the credentials for starting the process.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the credentials for starting the process.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Present" to ensure that the process exists.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Present" to ensure that the process exists.

trans-unit.source: The path to which the processes write standard error.
trans-unit.target: The path to which the processes write standard error.

trans-unit.source: Any existing file there will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: Any existing file there will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The stream from which the process receives standard input.
trans-unit.target: The stream from which the process receives standard input.

trans-unit.source: The path of the file to which the processes write standard output.
trans-unit.target: The path of the file to which the processes write standard output.

trans-unit.source: Any existing file there will be overwritten.
trans-unit.target: Any existing file there will be overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The location used as the current working directory for the processes.
trans-unit.target: The location used as the current working directory for the processes.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **_ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`` .
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **_ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is `DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName"`` .
